text: Peter Arnold Cronjé (21 September 1949 – 4 September 2020) was a South African rugby union player. He was born in Johannesburg. From 1971 to 1974, he played for the national rugby team. From 1970 to 1976, he played for the Golden Lions. Cronjé died on 4 September 2020, aged 70. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2020 deaths Category:South African rugby union players Category:Sportspeople from Johannesburg
title: Peter Cronjé
